subject: Ethics
title: Nuclear Waste and Future People
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Nuclear Waste and Future People.

hook.text: Finland is burying nuclear waste in tunnels designed to stay sealed for 100,000 years. Will the warnings last?

buildup.text: Spent nuclear fuel remains dangerous for hundreds of thousands of years‚Äîfar longer than any civilization has lasted.

discovery.text: Engineers must design warning signs for people who won't speak our languages or share our symbols.

twist.text: Some proposals include 'atomic priesthoods'‚Äîcults that pass down warnings through generations of ritual.

climax.text: We enjoy cheap electricity now. Strangers in 100,000 years manage our radioactive trash.

punchline.text: Our energy today. Their problem for 100,000 years.

quiz.question: What ethical challenge does nuclear waste storage pose for future generations?
options: Future people must manage dangerous waste for millennia without having chosen to create it
Nuclear waste becomes safe within a few decades
Nuclear waste can be safely dumped in the ocean
